Using Change Requests

This application includes a powerful search and/or reporting mechanism that allows change requests and suggestions about possible improvements to a project to be entered, assigned to a team member, and tracked. When the team member fixes the problem or otherwise resolves it (for example, by identifying it as a duplicate), he or she records this fact in the program.

Unlike other defect tracking systems, however, it also offers these advanced features:

  • Change requests can be linked to folders and other items by developers and testers.

  • Defects can be marked as fixed at the same time that the files are checked in – one operation in one application instead of two operations in separate applications.

  • Labels automatically become associated with the fixed defect when the next build is designated. Thus, testers know exactly what build to test for the fix, avoiding confusion.
